Neither team was able to take the initiative and dominate the first half. The home players attempt to beat the opposition's defence using mostly counter-attacks. The away team tries to prevail using combination football.

The home team attempted to leave the opposition defence outnumbered and hit them on the break. The visitors tried to keep the ball on the ground and play a passing game.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The match between FC Koln and Borussia Dortmund ended in a 1-1 draw after a highly competitive and somewhat scrappy 90 minutes of football. Both teams entered the game looking to secure vital points but had to settle for a point apiece after a flurry of fouls, free kicks, and some intermittent moments of exciting football. Here’s a detailed breakdown of the match that unfolded at the RheinEnergieStadion.

The game kicked off with Borussia Dortmund getting things started. Immediately, both teams seemed eager to take control, with some quick, early exchanges. However, the play was very disjointed in the opening few minutes with the ball frequently going out of play and a series of throw-ins by both sides. The first sign of a scoring opportunity arose when Dortmund managed to get a shot off target just over a minute into the game. This was quickly followed by FC Koln clearing their lines, setting the tone for a game that would see both defenses called into frequent action.

Dortmund sought to assert themselves offensively with an early shot on target at the three-minute mark, demonstrating their attacking intent. Nevertheless, they were sometimes clumsy going forward, evidenced by a series of fouls that followed in quick succession. Erik Durm was particularly aggressive, committing a foul with a slide tackle at the 10:47 mark, setting up an indirect free kick for FC Koln.

Throughout the first quarter-hour, the pattern of the game saw Dortmund often trying to press higher up the pitch while FC Koln's strategy seemed predicated on counter-attacks. There were several long passes and clearances by both teams as they struggled to carve out clear chances. Around the 14th minute, Julian Weigl attempted to find Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, but misplaced his pass, resulting in a goal kick for FC Koln.

Around the 17-minute mark, Dortmund began to string together some more cohesive attacks, with Dembele looking particularly lively. However, FC Koln’s defense was resolute, managing several clearances and dealing with the danger effectively. The match’s first booking came when Marcel Schmelzer was shown a yellow card for a foul, resulting in a free kick for FC Koln. This set off a sequence that saw FC Koln taking the lead in the 28th minute - Artjoms Rudnevs met the free kick with a thunderous header that gave Koln the lead and sent the home fans into jubilation.

Following the goal, Dortmund appeared somewhat rattled, committing several more fouls as they sought to regain composure. Nonetheless, their attacking verve never entirely disappeared, and they continued to press for an equalizer. Marco Reus was particularly active but also somewhat wasteful, as indicated when he missed a huge opportunity just outside the box, resulting in a goal kick.

Reus wasn't Dortmund’s only source of frustration; Dembele also spurned a chance just before the close of the first half. The unpredictable tempo saw several stoppages due to fouls from both sides — in fact, the half ended with a yellow card to Dembele for arguments with the referee. Both teams went into the break with Koln holding a narrow 1-0 lead, but Dortmund having shown sufficient indications that they could still turn the game around.

The second half resumed with a lot of the same intensity and lack of fluidity that characterized much of the first 45 minutes. FC Koln kicked off and both teams wrestled for control. Early fouls by each team disrupted the flow of the game. Anthony Modeste looked lively for FC Koln but was continually thwarted by a well-marshaled Dortmund defense.

The 5th minute saw Dortmund making a substitution, an attempt perhaps to inject some fresh legs and ideas into their attacks, with Sebastian Rode replacing Gonzalo Castro. Shortly after, FC Koln's Dominique Heintz was shown a yellow card, evidence of the growing tension and competitive nature of the match.

Dortmund had their chances from several corners and indirect free-kicks but continued to struggle to find their target, often hitting the ball wide. FC Koln, in turn, looked to capitalize on the counter-attack, coming close with several efforts that forced Dortmund’s defense into action.

By the midpoint of the second half, Dortmund had made further attempts to reshuffle, bringing on Adrian Ramos for increased offensive potency. FC Koln responded with a substitution of their own, bringing on Konstantin Rausch. The changes did little to alter the game’s physical nature, with more fouls committed on both ends of the pitch.

There was a pivotal moment at the 44:34 mark when Marco Reus finally broke the deadlock for Dortmund. Adrian Ramos played a crucial role, assisting Reus who beat the keeper with a fine shot into the bottom right corner, levelling the match at 1-1 as the game entered its final minutes.

The closing stages saw Salih Ozcan of FC Koln dismissed after earning a second yellow card for repeated fouling. Despite being down to ten men, Koln managed to hold onto the draw, thanks to some resolute defending and a lack of clinical finishing from Dortmund.

The game concluded with both sides reflecting on what could have been. Dortmund will rue the missed chances and frequent fouls that disrupted their rhythm and prevented them from asserting more dominance over the game. FC Koln, despite being reduced to ten men, will take heart from their defensive resilience and ability to carve out opportunities against a high-caliber opponent.

In summary, this was a match that had its share of thrilling moments but was also plagued by interruptions and lack of smooth play. Both teams had their spells of control but ultimately couldn’t capitalize on them fully. FC Koln’s strategy of quick counter-attacks worked effectively to an extent but was marred by repeated fouling. Dortmund, on the other hand, dominated possession with their combination football, yet their finishing left much to be desired. Ending in a stalemate, the match was a hard-fought encounter reflecting the competitive spirit of both sides.
